author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin on Wednesday said the process of interviewing aspirants for party tickets for the Assembly election was progressing well and denied reports that he had refused to be part of the interview panel on Tuesday.

“I read about it (him skipping the interview) only in newspapers. The interviews are progressing well,” he told journalists.

Mr. Stalin disapproved of various State departments organising events to mark the 68th birthday of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa and called it as an abuse of state machinery.
title: Stalin denies rift with his father
